instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short on the GND
threads.message:
[B]Hello everyone, in general[/B]


There was a slight flooding in the area of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> + corrosion. There was no backlight, but the beech started and showed a picture. Locally cleaned the board in the area of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, removed and installed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, soldered the nearby resistors and capacitors, after that there is no more startup and a short circuit appeared on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>

[B]What was done:
Removed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6101</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C6101</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C3280</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C3281</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8070</CAPACITOR> There is no result

L7430 is removed
Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_L</SIGNAL>) is clean
Pin 2 (<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL>) is shorted on the GND

Diod mode:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> .004
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> .004
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> .002
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> .005

No idea[/B]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short on the GND
threads.message:
Having short on all these rails is really bad; it points to dead PCH.

Did you remove power when checked diode mode?
Remove all filter caps from <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> and check if still short there.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short on the GND
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 87153, member: 682"]
Having short on all these rails is really bad; it points to dead PCH.

Did you remove power when checked diode mode?
Remove all filter caps from <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> and check if still short there.
[/QUOTE]

[B]-Did you remove power when checked diode mode?[/B]
what do You mean? Have I disconnected the battery and MagSafe?

[B]-Remove all filter caps from <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> and check if still short there.[/B]
You mean <CAPACITOR>C0890</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C0891</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C0892</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short on the GND
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C0890</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C0891</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C0892</CAPACITOR> are removed, <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> still short on the GND

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short on the GND
threads.message:
"what do You mean? Have I disconnected the battery and MagSafe?"
Yes, cannot check diode mode with power applied on the board.

"<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> still short on the GND"
If you removed mentioned caps from RTC power rail and also <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, then PCH is shorted to ground.

BTW, any reason to quote an entire post visible few centimeters above?
Write directly on reply box, instead of clicking Reply button.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...
